result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DE will provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge

You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
DE will complete an AODA assessment and follow up with any recommended treatment
Judgment will be entered in favor of the State in 15CV116

timeConds.notes: Jail will be served at the direction of the DOC agent.  DE will be allowed huber privilege.

records.addlTxt: Case settlement
DE has indicated undecided at this time about seeking PCR

Defendant William R Richardson in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF164, 15CV116.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

15CF163-DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 1.  Ct 2 will be DRI. Court will accept find DE guilty.

15CV116-DE will allow forfeiture to the State

15CF164- DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 4.  Ct's 1,2,3 will be DRI.  Court will accept and find DE guilty. 

Court will accept the recommendations of the parties, will order sentence withheld, 3 years probation, CC, DNA sample and surcharge, 75 days jail with huber, restitution of $100.00, must complete an AODA assessment and any followup recommended, will allow judgment in favor of the State in 15CV116.  Has credit for 8 days.  Jail time will be a condition of probation, served at the direction of the DOC agent.  DE will report to DOC today.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 31, 2017 at 11:00 am.

All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.  Bonds concurrent.  No discussion of case with potential witnesses.
